title: For Sale:  Kestrel 4500NV Pocket Weather Tracker w/ HORUS ATRAG
postcontent:
MOD Armory
2834 Janitell Rd
Colorado Springs CO 80906
Monday to Friday 9am to 6pm
REDACTED

Kestrel 4500NV w/ HORUS ATRAG Ballistics 

P/N: 0845HOLV (Olive Drab) & 0845HTAN (Desert Tan)

The Kestrel 4500 NV with Horus ATrag Ballistics combines Kestrel's flagship meter, the Kestrel 4500 with Night Vision, with Horus ATrag Ballistics software to bring you the first lightweight, hand-held tool to give you both comprehensive environmental data plus integrated aiming solutions. Kestrel Pocket Weather Meters and Horus Vision partnered to provide a powerful shooting tool that combines the critical environmental data and targeting software solutions required for precision shooting. The Kestrel 4500 NV with Horus ATrag Ballistics allows you to load, customize and store multiple guns, rounds and targets. Target parameters include distance, angle, longitude, speed, direction and wind. Kestrel's highly accurate measuring and averaging of wind together with built-in digital compass for target bearing and wind direction assists in defining the target winds. 

Pre-programmed Guns: This unit can be used with any combination of scope and reticle, here are several pre-programmed guns that come in each unit The Kestrel can measure in TMOA (true minute of angle), SMOA (shooter minute of angle), and MILs (milliradians). The unit displays ballistic tables with data of the shot extending out to various distances (see Range Card on page 17 and 18 in the manual). 

This Horus meter can provide ballistics solutions out to 4000 yards (or about 3700 meters). Once you’ve built the gun that you’ll be using (and you’re at the range of course), you need to enter the target range into the Kestrel, as well as the latitude (if you’re concerned about the coriolis effect), then either manually enter the wind or use the auto capture feature to capture the wind speed. Horus software that comes with the 4500 Atrag Ballistics is the civilian version. 

The military version of the Horus ATrag Ballistics software is only available via special GSA contract to officials with the correct security clearance. The software that ships with the Kestrel 4500 Horus ATrag is version 3.0. It is possible to upgrade the firmware as new versions become available, however it will need to be returned for firmware updates. 

Kestrel 4500 Measures 
•Heading (true & magnetic) 
•Wind direction 
•Crosswind 
•Headwind/tailwind 
•Altitude 
•Pressure trend 
•Barometric pressure 
•Wet bulb temperature 
•Relative humidity in % 
•Heat stress index
•Dewpoint 
•Wet bulb temperature 
•Density altitude 
•Wind chill Air, water, and snow temperature °F or °C 
•Current, average, and maximum air velocity 

Kestrel 4500 Features 
•Waterproof and floats 
•Time and date Easy- to-read backlit display 
•Data Logger (automatic and manual) 
•Customizable data storage - 2900 data points 
•Minimum, Maximum and Average values 
•Multi-Function 3-line display 
•Humidity sensor can be recalibrated in the field with our Relative Humidity Calibration Kit. 
•Exterior temperature, humidity, and pressure sensors for fast and accurate readings 
•Customize screens to display user-selected measurements 
•Graph and recall trends 
•User-replaceable impeller 
•Flip-top impeller cover allows use of other functions while protecting the impeller 
•Data charting
•Upload to a computer (with optional interface) 
•Five languages (English, French, Spanish, German, and Italian)

Assembled in the USA Kestrel 4500 Includes 
•Soft carry pouch 
•Neck lanyard 
•Batteries - 2 AAA 
•Kestrel Certificate of Conformity

title: For Sale:  INLAND ~ M1A1 PARATROOPER WWII -- M1 Carbine...1-43, High Wood, ALL ORIGINAL...C&R
postcontent: an WWII M1A1 Paratrooper carbine that could have dropped behind enemy lines on D-Day during WWII, here it is! This is an original condition, early production, Inland M1A1. This carbine is in very good shape and retains all of the original early features including the very scarce "High Wood" folding stock, 2-position "Flip Sight", narrow barrel band, checkered safety, dog-leg hammer, etc. There are NO import markings and this IS NOT A RESTORATION. There are no punch marks in the rear sight dovetail, nor any wide band marks on the stock or barrel. The barrel date is 1-43 which is correct for the serial number (181178) and also correct for the high wood stock. The original finish shows some thinning, a few small pits to the left edge of the receiver along the wood line, and some light corrosion to the front and rear sights...but the overall appearance is very good. The stock is in very good shape with normal wear, dents, dings and scrapes. The mechanics are in perfect working order and the bore is excellent...bright with strong rifling and a muzzle erosion reading of about 1.4 (quite good). There is old grease and dried oil in this gun and I'm leaving it there for the enjoyment of the new owner. This gun had been sitting so long that the safety was actually frozen with dried oil when I got it, but has been freed up to work fine. Comes with a 15-round Type II magazine, original khaki sling (the sling is soiled and buckle is some sort of undersized replacement), and a "US" marked oiler. An absolutely great gun for the military collector

**PLEASE READ** 

FIREARM INFORMATION

The item up for sale is a Smith & Wesson 910 model .9mm semi-automatic handgun in very good condition. This version has the aluminum alloy slide and frame, making it one-of-a-kind on this site. The sale includes one (1) S&W factory 15-round magazine and gun sleeve. This firearm was originally purchased without a case or documentation, therefore they are not included in this sale. Visible blemishes include minor wear on the frame, slide, and barrel with minor-to-moderate wear on all sides of the grip. There is also a small chip on the frame portion of the grip below the trigger guard. Internally, this firearm is very clean and shows little-to-no wear. I would rate it at 90%. This item is being sold as-is with no manufacturer's warranty stated or otherwise implied. The sale of this firearm is final and returns WILL NOT be accepted under any circumstances so ask questions BEFORE committing to purchase. I check my email often throughout the day and will usually respond within 12 hours. This is NOT my first time selling an item so you can buy with confidence. More details about this firearm are listed below.  

PAYMENT

Payment should be made within ten (10) days of the sale ending. Failure to pay in a timely fashion may result in the item being re-listed and the transaction being canceled. I will accept the following forms of payment: money order, cashier's check, personal check, credit card by phone (add 3.5% to total if paying with Visa/MasterCard or Amex), and PayPal (add 3% to total if paying through PayPal). Item will be shipped or transferred ONLY when payment has been deposited and cleared.

SHIPPING (IF NECESSARY)

The winning buyer assumes the cost of shipping for this item. Shipping cost is a flat rate of $25 sent via USPS priority mail + $5 optional insurance and will be sent by my FFL dealer in order to comply with applicable laws. Shipping cost will be added to the total price at the end of the auction. THIS ITEM CAN NOT AND WILL NOT BE SHIPPED TO A STATE WHERE IT IS ILLEGAL TO SHIP FIREARMS. KNOW YOUR STATE LAWS BEFORE BIDDING. The item can only be shipped to a licensed FFL dealer. A copy of the your FFL dealer's license will need to be emailed or faxed to me or my FFL dealer prior to shipment. Item will be shipped when payment and FFL dealer requirements have been met.

TRANSFER
If the buyer is local and would like to meet in-person to transfer the firearm, the buyer and seller must mutually agree on the meeting place. Although transfer fees vary depending on the FFL dealer, one should be selected which is reasonably priced and situated in a centrally accessible location. The buyer will be responsible for paying his/her own transfer fee ONLY. Both parties must be in mutual agreement when planning to meet and transfer the firearm. Generally, weekends are better for me, but I can also make arrangements for weekdays after 5:00 PM. If either party MUST cancel the transfer, please notify each other at least 24 hours in advance. 

ADDITIONAL FIREARM DETAILS

Smith & Wesson Model 910

Production history

Produced: 1995–present

Sights: Fixed three-dot
The Smith & Wesson Model 910 is a full-sized, 9×19mm Parabellum (9mm Luger), short recoil operated, semi-automatic pistol that was introduced by Smith & Wesson in 1995. The Model 910 pistol features a double action/single action trigger and has a four-inch barrel, an aluminum alloy frame, and a slide-mounted de-cocking safety (similar to the one on the MIL-SPEC M9 Beretta pistol). The sighting system of the Model 910 consists of high visibility three-dot fixed sights. Both the 910 and its predecessor, the very similar S&W 915, are essentially budget-priced versions of Smith and Wesson's highly successful 59 series, full-sized double-action 9mm's with staggered-stack magazines.

Smaller,lighter and always fast with three reticle options. With the new single battery configuration, the XPS allows more rail space than ever, leaving more room for rear iron sights or NV mount.

I’m an IT professional with over thirty years experience that can fix just about any problem you might have with your PC. Sorry, PC only as I don’t subscribe to Apple.

I can re-install your Windows (upgrade you from Vista to Windows 7 for example) and include Microsoft Office 2007 Pro as well as create an archive of your data. Have you backed up those pictures and videos you’ve been collecting for the last 4 years? Hard drives do fail. I’m willing to do this for 2 bricks of 22 lr. I do this sort of service on the side from time to time and usually get around $100. Everything is negotiable. If you only have a brick or two and need more than just a few hours work, or parts, we could negotiate a little cash as well.

I called him Sunday because this model shotgun hasnt been sold as new for several years, so I was wondering how he happened to have a new one. This was an unnamed spherical rifle propellant when the late Bruce Hodgdon first used it. When a 38.0 grain charge behind a 52 grain bullet gave one hole groups from his 22 caliber wildcat (now called the 22-250), he appropriately named the powder H380. H380 is also a superb performer in the 220 Swift, 243, 257 Roberts and other fine varmint cartridges

title: For Sale:  Steyr AUG A1 903SA Series Bullpup Rifle
postcontent:
Good condition Steyr AUG A1 903SAXXX Rifle, chambered in 5.56/.223, with 16" barrel. Original Austrian Gun South pre-94 import, 1985 production year. OD green furniture with (1) 30rd magazine. 

The barrel is a rare 16" factory cold hammer forged Austrian barrel imported by Gun South (1 of 500 imported) with closed flash hider. The bore is shiny and perfect. Factory AUGs usually came with a 20" CHF barrel. 

The rifle also has the newer roller bolt carrier. Ready for registered drop-in trigger packs.

There is some character wear on the receiver, with most being on the scope carry handle. The Swarovski 1.5x glass with donut reticle is perfect, however. Everything looks a lot better in person than in the pictures.

Will come with your choice of Right hand hybrid bolt or Left hand bolt. 

$2650 or best reasonable offer.

Partial trades considered: Pocket 9mm (Rohrbaugh R9, Kahr CM9, Sccy CPX-2), RIA 1911, Steyr Scout, and/or Ammunition.

Thanks.

title: For Sale:  Flag the gouging ammo sellers
postcontent: Let's get rid of these scum ammo gougers trying to take advantage of shooters who actually shoot their guns and are running low on ammo. You can buy ammo these days at Cabela's, West Coast Armory, Federal Way Discount, Ben's Loans for a little over panic prices.  So let's over-priced flag these yayhoos charging .$50 a round for 22lr or 4 times what they paid for 9mm.  There's one idiot who took pictures of his ammo for sale that clearly shows he paid $22 a box of 50 9mm JHP and he wants $110 a box for it.  What a waste of air.  Flag these assholes everytime you get online and let's clean up our own hobby.  These nitwits probably don't even own guns because they found some panic buyer who overpaid the past few months.  GET RID OF THESE GOUGERS!

title: For Sale:  Smith & Wesson model 910 .9MM - VERY GOOD CONDITION
location: Outside Philadelphia, Bucks County, Southeastern, PA, Pennsylvania
postcontent:
**PLEASE READ** This firearm is also listed for auction/sale on GunBroker.com and will only be removed from either site if it is bought and paid for in full. Refer to my Gun Broker ID "TLDR1VER" for details on the auction.

FIREARM INFORMATION

The item up for sale is a Smith & Wesson 910 model .9mm semi-automatic handgun in very good condition. This version has the aluminum alloy slide and frame, making it one-of-a-kind on this site. The sale includes one (1) S&W factory 15-round magazine and gun sleeve. This firearm was originally purchased without a case or documentation, therefore they are not included in this sale. Visible blemishes include minor wear on the frame, slide, and barrel with minor-to-moderate wear on all sides of the grip. There is also a small chip on the frame portion of the grip below the trigger guard. Internally, this firearm is very clean and shows little-to-no wear. I would rate it at 90%. This item is being sold as-is with no manufacturer's warranty stated or otherwise implied. The sale of this firearm is final and returns WILL NOT be accepted under any circumstances so ask questions BEFORE committing to purchase. I check my email often throughout the day and will usually respond within 12 hours. This is NOT my first time selling an item so you can buy with confidence. More details about this firearm are listed below.

PAYMENT

Payment should be made within ten (10) days of the sale ending. Failure to pay in a timely fashion may result in the item being re-listed and the transaction being canceled. I will accept the following forms of payment: money order, cashier's check, personal check, credit card by phone (add 3.5% to total if paying with Visa/MasterCard or Amex), and PayPal (add 3% to total if paying through PayPal). Item will be shipped or transferred ONLY when payment has been deposited and cleared.

SHIPPING (IF NECESSARY)

The winning buyer assumes the cost of shipping for this item. Shipping cost is a flat rate of $25 sent via USPS priority mail + $5 optional insurance and will be sent by my FFL dealer in order to comply with applicable laws. Shipping cost will be added to the total price at the end of the auction. THIS ITEM CAN NOT AND WILL NOT BE SHIPPED TO A STATE WHERE IT IS ILLEGAL TO SHIP FIREARMS. KNOW YOUR STATE LAWS BEFORE BIDDING. The item can only be shipped to a licensed FFL dealer. A copy of the your FFL dealer's license will need to be emailed or faxed to me or my FFL dealer prior to shipment. Item will be shipped when payment and FFL dealer requirements have been met.

TRANSFER
If the buyer is local and would like to meet in-person to transfer the firearm, the buyer and seller must mutually agree on the meeting place. Although transfer fees vary depending on the FFL dealer, one should be selected which is reasonably priced and situated in a centrally accessible location. The buyer will be responsible for paying his/her own transfer fee ONLY. Both parties must be in mutual agreement when planning to meet and transfer the firearm. Generally, weekends are better for me, but I can also make arrangements for weekdays after 5:00 PM. If either party MUST cancel the transfer, please notify each other at least 24 hours in advance.

ADDITIONAL FIREARM DETAILS

Smith & Wesson Model 910
Type: Semi-automatic pistol
Place of origin: United States
Production history
Manufacturer: Smith and Wesson
Produced: 1995–present
Variants: Model 908
Specifications
Weight: 38 ounces
Length: 7 3⁄8 inches
Barrel length: 4 inches
Caliber: 9×19mm Parabellum
Action: Short recoil DA/SA
Feed system: 15 round detachable box magazine
Sights: Fixed three-dot
The Smith & Wesson Model 910 is a full-sized, 9×19mm Parabellum (9mm Luger), short recoil operated, semi-automatic pistol that was introduced by Smith & Wesson in 1995. The Model 910 pistol features a double action/single action trigger and has a four-inch barrel, an aluminum alloy frame, and a slide-mounted de-cocking safety (similar to the one on the MIL-SPEC M9 Beretta pistol). The sighting system of the Model 910 consists of high visibility three-dot fixed sights. Both the 910 and its predecessor, the very similar S&W 915, are essentially budget-priced versions of Smith and Wesson's highly successful 59 series, full-sized double-action 9mm's with staggered-stack magazines.

title: For Sale/Trade:  SAIGA 7.62X39 SEMI-AUTO RIFLE CONVERTED 922(R) COMPLIANT + HI CAP MAGS!
postcontent:
On the block is my Saiga 7.62 semi-automatic rifle. Rifle is 16.5" barrel length.

Saigas are produced at the Izhmash factory in Russia, the same factory that produces the russian AKs. This Saiga was purchased in November 2012 from Dunhams (have reciepts) and has had about 200 rds put through it. Saiga barrels are chrome-lined for increased durability.

The rifle has been converted to a traditional AK set up, moving the trigger group forward, installing an upgraded fire control group from Tromix, KVAR buttstock and a pistol grip (all U.S. made for 922 compliance). Also installed a bullet guide to allow the rifle to accept standard AK magazines. 

Rifle includes the factory 10 rd magazine, another factory 5 rd. mag, and 3 Tapco 30 rd smoothside polymer AK mags. Also have the original buttstock and trigger group, if for some crazy reason you get the notion to convert it back. 

Feel free to ask if you have any questions, I'm looking to get a Romanian PSL in trade, or $1000 firm + shipping/FFL if you're not in state and meeting face to face. I much prefer to just meet face to face

Output is 65 lumens for one-hour of runtime using the P60 lamp assembly (two included) or 120 lumens for 20 minutes using the P61 lamp assembly (optional-not included). The tailcap switch assembly features a momentary/constant-on pushbutton switch and a momentary-on tape switch (7-inch cable) that attaches to your preferred location via self-stick Velcro® backing.

This build was focused on functionality while still maintaining good looks. I did not want to add a ton of weight so in my opinion all the mods are well worth their weight to make the cut.

I also made a point to make this Draco as controllable as possible. I feel I have done well.

The recoil reduction and taming of the muzzle rise with the Muzzle break and Recoil buffer was the first step.

Next, I wanted to create a stable shooting platform. I combined the Magpul MS3 Sling along with the Magpul XTM Hand Stop to be able to apply enough forward pressure to really make the difference. While a buttstock will always be better, this setup is as good as you can get without one. It is Rock Steady.

Would be great if you did want to SBR it.

It is not an exaggeration that when I fire this off, everyone in the range comes to take a look.

that tames the prehistoric characteristic that most revolvers possess. The
Chiappa Rhino barrel is aligned with the bottom most chamber which is the
key component to Rhino's tame characteristics. The position of the barrel
lowers the center of gravity and yields a centerline of the bore more in
line with the shooter's arm allowing for the most natural "point ability"
while engaging a target. This characteristic also drastically reduces both
recoil and muzzle flip which insures subsequent shots to be on target
faster than ever before. The reduction of the recoil allows for the use of
ultra light alloys to be used in the construction of the Rhino minimizing
any adverse effect. The flat sided cylinder design of the Rhino reduces the
typical revolver profile allowing greater concealment. With choices from 2"
